comments.body: scalac-style comments do not put the `*` here :).

comments.body: We usually use two spaces to distinguish code block, not `````

comments.body:
> What do you gain from using classes for all of this instead of methods?

@smarter: the syntax formatter won't format something that is already formatted.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +84,88 @@          hl.show
        case hb: HighlightBuffer =>
          hb.toString
        case str: String if ctx.settings.color.value != "never" =>
          new String(SyntaxHighlighting(str).toArray)

comments.body: I'm wondering if it wouldn't be nicer to move the string interpolators here, it's not like anyone is going to use the a formatter by hand without using the corresponding interpolator
Decorators acts like an extended Predef for the dotty compiler. Since string interpolators are ubiquitous I think they should be part of it, and not require a separate import.
